ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This class gave me a firm grounding in Caribbean and slavery history and the ability to read roughly 200 pages a week with relative ease.
I learned about more Caribbean places than I knew existed before
I learned about how to think about colonialism and neoliberalism on very large scales.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course was amazing and Professor Eller is amazing.
I think there was a lot of good literature, though it was super dry at times. A lot was learned through the readings, but more so through the mini-lectures Professor Eller gave.

Professor was incredible and brilliant and added greatly to the material from her own knowledge rather than just having us assess the readings. Extremely important subject presented in a way that did its significance justice. Professor did some lecturing which does not usually happen in seminars but was fine with me because again this information gave a new depth to the readings. If anything maybe needed some better facilitation of discussion - class was somewhat shyer at first so could have used some more directed questions.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: YES, even if you're not a humanity major!
Yes. Take it. Professor Eller is amazing and the subject matter is difficult to learn about but fascinating.
Absolutely! Professor Eller is a literal database of knowledge on the Caribbean; it is a privilege to take the class with her!
Definitely yes! I loved it and Professor Eller is amazing!

Yes! Absolutely, this is my favorite course I've taken at Yale. It's fabulous. You learn so much and can gain an entire new perspective on the world. Also Professor Eller is incredible and brilliant so you would pretty much get a lot out of any course with her.
